39453247.review:
Okay now this game is just hard to review because what [i]hasn’t[/i] been about this game? It’s a classic 90s FPS featuring fast-paced, skill-based combat where the only way to win is to get the super fun guns first and steam roll the competition. [i]Unreal Tournament[/i] was originally released in 1999 exclusively for Windows but later got ported to Mac, PlayStation 2, and the Dreamcast over the course of 2000 and 2001 (it was [b]that[/b] popular). And while originally intended as an expansion of the original [i]Unreal[/i], it was so successful, that it became its own series and pretty much overshadowed the original single-player focused game.

The story is pretty much what you’d expect from a 90s FPS, you’re the latest contestant in the titular tournament that started as a way to end violent miner riots and your goal is to win. And that’s pretty much it. 

Now the game does have various modes to help spice things up (cause deathmatch would get boring after a while). First you have the standard deathmatch modes which basically are getting to the set number of frags first either in a chaotic free-for-all or as a team. Capture the flag, which is trying to take the enemy flag while defending yours. Last man standing which is pretty much FFA deathmatch with the added twist of limited lives. And assault which your basic attack/defend gamemode. All of these which can be played either with real world players or with various bots and even possibly putting some mutators to spice things a bit (or a lot. or in some cases [b]literally[/b]).

Now running on the original Unreal Engine, this game runs like a dream on any modern computer with a graphics card and ran super well when I played this on a laptop running a 64-bit Windows 8.1 much like the Id Tech game released around the same time,

Overall this game is worth the time and money and definitely pick up the deal pack when it’s on sale.

39235592.review:
[WARNING: IMPROPER MOUSE READING]

[RECOMMENDED TO OLDSCHOOL FANS and fans of the old school who want to try a classic for what it is]

[NOT RECOMMENDED TO: Anyone else]

Over the past 15 years I have had multiple revisits to UT games and UT99 in particular and all in all it would add up to a lot of game time. In this review I will focus on what prevents UT99 from staying contemporary and what gradually have made it die out.

UT was a great game despite some of its flaws but with time other games have come around and what was not much of a flaw back in the day had now become one (like the mouse issue, which probably was not sensible with a ball mouse).

The original flaw of weapon imbalance (which prevented it from becoming an esport) is a part of the game itself and others are the lack of certain settings that could and should have been added over the years to keep the game a bit "up to date".

This could especially have been expected to have happened along with a steam release or some anniversary but that has not been the case.

One of these elementary updates could have fixed the mouse problem for which I have tried just about everything to solve and still persists. Note, this mouse problem persists regardless of mouse, Windows version, Pointer Presicion on or off, OpenGL dll replacement or ingame settings and it manifests itself through sensitivity irregularities of some sort and what feels like some kind of filter.


Other updates to the game could have included:


- Resolution update so 1080p, 1440p, 4k etc and other resolutions and upcoming resolutions can be set via menu.

- Centre all hits so that everything your fire lands in the middle of the screen (should atleast be optional for those who prefer it)

- Steam Clouding for all settings and game progress

- Various Crosshairsettings 

- Add FOV settings in regular menu (instead of consol commands)

- Gun position option through coordinates (x y z)

- Enemy brightskins or highlighters (everyone are currently a bit camoflaged)


There are more neutral updates like the ones above that would keep the game up to date without changing it.


Recommended for:

* People who want the good old game 


Not Recommended for:

* Everyone that falls outside of "People who want the good old game"


Since the latter one is the larger group I will give this a negative rating.

39048914.review:
Моя первая игра. Что о ней можно сказать? Это легенда своего времени.
Но что же сейчас - в 2018 году? Я думаю если вы не любитель старых игр, не имеете тяги к бессюжетным битвам против ботов и других игроков или не фанат серии Unreal Tournament - то скорее всего вам эта игра не понравится.
Но я думаю по скидке её стоит купить. А лучше сразу Unreal Deal Pack по той же цене (когда действует 90% скидка) сразу со всеми играми серии.
Пожалуй расскажу о + и - в реалиях 2018 года.
Плюсы:
1. Пропитана духом игр 90-х и 2000-х годов - очень лампово играется, мне такое нравится.
2. Большое количество карт и несколько режимов игры - 4 режима, карт наверно штук 50, не меньше. Есть режим челленджа, там 5 карт, но его без уменьшения скорости в игре наверно невозможно пройти на среднем уровне сложности. Лично я на стандартной скорости не смог) 
3. В самом турнире (вся игра это типо турнир где надо всех победить) есть челлендж - выше я уже сказал немного, можете поверить на слово, на максимальной сложности это и правда нереальный турнир.
4. Небольшое разнообразие в оружии - около 10 пушек, ещё с помощью мутатор (типо дополнительных настроек матча) можно добавить несколько орудий убийства. 
Минусы:
1. Графика - тут всё ясно, игра 99 года выпуска.
2. Оптимизация - на современное железо и windows выше xp играть нормально нельзя. Можно поставить фиксы, переделку под 10 directX, новые текстуры, но это сильно снижает производительность на разрешениях больше 800x600. На разрешении 800x600  играется идеально.
3. Сюжет - его вообще-то тут нет, да и не особо надо.
Вот и всё что я могу сказать об игре учитывая то, сколько ей лет.
Покупать игру или нет решайте сами, я советую притронуться к культуре игр 90-х и считаю что эта игра будет хорошим опытом в познании игровой индустрии.
Всё же не могу не пустить ностальгическую слезу играя в такое, поэтому даю оценку в 10 "ай ин ю тим идиот" из 10.

39031599.review:
I grew up playing this game, so take this review how you want.

Currently running it on a 32bit Potato and it runs smooth as butter just as, if not better than it did originally.
They have upped the resolutions to fit more modern 64bit machines, though i have witnessed a small issue when booting it up for some on such machines. A problem easily bypassed by setting compatibility to wXPsp2 much like most games from that era on modern machines.

The online community is still there all be it small they are just as fun and ferocious. 
However, I don't play this to play online, i play it on LAN with my mates for 'retro' *shudder* lan party pissups and the experience reigns true to back in the day right down to the high pitched squeels people make when you run up to them with the Impact Hammer >:)

The maps and game modes are a true gem of this game. 
The Maps are well balanced, exceptionally well designed and flow fantastically and a true testiment to the tallent behind it. The Game modes and Mutators keep it fresh even today. Getting bored? INSTAGIB FACING WORLDS BIIIISH

Not to mention the music, ooohhh the music. (DM-Gothic wins)

As far as LAN play goes, you will have to 'set up' a dedicated server on some ones PC that runs in the background. 
It unsurprisingly, has little to no hit to CPU power, even in large populated games.

Which brings me to the UUUUUUUUGE catalog of amazing mods. 
Due to the sheer amount of them i will name two of my favourites: 
CHAOS UT: adds mele weapons like battle axes and really mixes up the game. 
Matrix Mod: Adds wall running and Bullet time (i don't recommend the latter option)

The core gameplay is as fun as it was on release day with the added bonus of some mods that fix some niggling issues some might have.

I can't recommend this game any higher than I do. It is truly a piece of gaming history that still holds up.

38798284.review: Przyznam szczerze, że nigdy wcześniej nie miałem okazji zagrać w Unreal Tournament. Po zakupie i ograniu tego tytułu stwierdzam, że pominięcie tego tytułu było dużym błędem. Co prawda, gra zestarzała się bardzo mocno pod względem audiowizualnym i może przez to kogoś odstraszyć, natomiast gra wciąż broni się wręcz wybornym gameplay'em. Gra jest dynamiczną strzelanką. W trybie singleplayer są dostępne 2 tryby: Tryb turnieju oraz tryb praktyki. W tym pierwszym przechodzimy po kolei mapy w danym trybie aż do zdobycia pucharu. W trybie praktyki no to typowo wybieramy mape, tryb, poziom trudności botów itd. Dysponujemy tutaj rożnorakimi broniami posiadających dwa funkcje. Jest ich około 10 i mamy tutaj jak na przykład karabin kwasowy, karabin maszynowy, dzieło odłamkowe, miotacz pił, karabin kwasowy i inne równie ciekawe bronie. Gra oferuje 6 trybów gry: Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, Capture The Flag, Assault, Last Man Standing oraz Domination. Gra posiada także sporą liczbę map do wyboru. Mapy te zostały świetnie wykonane i zostały umieszczone w różnorodnych miejscach. W grze znajdziemy też oczywiście tryb multiplayer. Po tylu latach wciąż są chętni do rozgrywki online, a multi oczywiście jest jeszcze lepsze od trybu single. Ponadto z tego co mi wiadomo to do tej gry można się zaopatrzyć w mody lub dodatkowe mapy od fanów, tak więc można dzięki temu spędzić dodatkowe miłe godziny z tą produkcją. Polecam, a dla fanów gier FPS jest to nawet pozycja obowiązkowa.

38642096.review:
Nearly 20 years later and this gem has yet to be matched in the multiplayer fps genre. Whilst there isn’t much in the way of story here, Unreal Tournament is one of the most fun games i’ve ever played. The maps are brilliant all perfectly designed for their specific game mode. Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, Domination, Last Man Standing, Capture The Flag and Assault are the game modes available with Deathmatch and Assault being my personal favourites but all are entertaining in their own way.

The frantic pace of the game combined with the verticality of the maps provides for awesome action and never ending fun. The ai is amazing because they react and play almost like a real person would. There is a legendary selection of weapons in the game each with their own unique aesthetic and function and all have a primary and secondary firing modes, some of which can be combined for devastating effect. Each gun has its own strengths and none of them are really useless. 

The soundtrack is also something of a masterpiece. The tracks perfectly fit the action and make the matches so intense. So what’s wrong with it? Well...nothing really. You’d have to seriously nitpick to find something because its just such a well designed game. Unreal Tournament is a timeless classic and i could not really recommend this game any more.

9.5/10

38349582.review:
one of the best games ever made. while other games may earn that title by being completely unique, masterfully designed, or progressive for video games as a medium, unreal tournament earns it by being a metric sh*t ton of fun. ut99 doesn't care about perfectly fine tuning and balancing everything for competitive play, or having a complex story, or even just making sense in general. all it cares about is letting you play whatever you want and do whatever you want within the confines of the game engine.

if you want, you can load up deck 16, add a handful of bots, and have a classic game of deathmatch. alternatively, you can play a never ending game of CTF on facing worlds, with 100s of bots added using console commands, and take part in the chaos. theres a bunch of mutators you mix and match, low gravity, super jumps, big-head mode, etc. you can play 6 game modes, with 70+ maps you can explore, from spaceships flying through hyperspace, to ancient gothic castles, to a giant island in a sea of lava, and much more. you have 12 weapons to mess around with that are batshit insane, you can gangsta lean duel wielded pistols, there's a gun that fires sawblades that explode, a gun that fires toxic goo, and a stupid OP sniper rifle that basically ruins the balance of the game but i don't care because i only play on bot match and its really fun to use.

there's an overwhelming amount of content and customisation options to play with here just in the vanilla game, and thats not including the fact that the game has [b]full mod support and console commands[/b]. and what sets all of this apart from a game like gmod, which is similarly customisable, is that underneath all of this wacky bullsh*t to mess around with, there is a solid, well designed multiplayer shooter that can stand up on its own two legs. its not just a vapid toy you p*ss around with for an hour or two then forget about it like gmod, there is genuinely enjoyable core gameplay here with a high skill ceiling that takes a lot of practice to reach. ut99 is a game that you will be coming back to for years to come once it gets its hooks in you.

if you like shooters, or are interested in the concept of fun in general, you seriously owe it to yourself to play this. start a practice match, pick a map, tweak the difficulty to your liking, and experience PC gaming's finest.

37843082.review:
El juego que nos trajo al mundo la legendaria frase [b]"MONSTER KILL"[/b] es, junto a Quake 3, la definicion del termino "FPS Arena". Mas de 10 armas, cada una con dos modos de disparos, hacen el armamento de Unreal Tournament uno de los mas simbolicos de la historia de los FPS. Ya sea un lanzacohetes que puede disparar 6 cohetes/granadas en simultaneo, el Flak Canno que es una fusion soñada entre una escopeta y un lanzagranadas, o un lanzazador de residuos toxicos, podras despedazar a tus enemigos de las maneras mas extremas y satisfactorias posibles.

Si no te alcanzan la enorme cantidad de mapas, skins y modos de juegos, puedes descargar una infinidad mas hechos por la comunidad a lo largo de sus casi 20 años de historia. 

Asi que toma tu rifle francotirador, ve a CTF-Face (Dos bases entrentadas en un asteroide flotando en el espacio) y preparate a entender de donde viene la palabra "Camper".

Recomiendo leer el articulo de PCGamingWiki para poder disfrutar el juego a su maxima potencia y resolver posible problemas de correr el juego en sistemas modernos:

[url=https://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Unreal_Tournament]Unreal Tournament en PCGamingWiki[/url]

This game is the hallmark of the modern arena shooter, and shielded by its own sake of nostalgia.

Only players that are very good at the game still play it. See if you can learn from them by repeatedly getting yout ass handed to you, and seeking out a few youtube videos made in moveimaker, on win XP.

36297960.review:
Played this game for hours before purchasing on Steam, but from what I can recall after playing this game over the years; it's nothing short of a masterpiece. Sure, many people of the modern generation will denounce this game due to the aging graphics but there are plenty of redeeming factors about this game.

The first time you run this game, you're introduced to the kick ass soundtrack of Unreal Tournament. Many modern first person shooter games seem to make their soundtrack sound as if they are from some hollywood studio whilst this game's soundtrack doesn't many you feel like an actor but rather it makes you feel like you're going to unleash the ultimate killing spree. The soundtrack is probably by far the best video game soundtrack I have ever heard, it packs memorable beats and further encourages you to play this game.

The maps in this game are definitely unique to those of modern first person shooter games, the maps provide a consistent atmosphere to the environment the game is set in. The maps are also very well designed and take advantage of simplicity and maze-like patters to utilise the gameplay. It feels so awesome to be jumping in low gravity on a giant rock with two towers spinning around in space, or to be shooting bots off elongated platforms into a massive pile of biosludge. There is so many good maps (in my opinion Facing Worlds and Deck16 are by far the best maps this game has to provide) giving you plenty of different ways you could play this game, such as vast environments give you more room to dodge attacks etc. The maps on this game are fantastic.

The weapons offer you many different ways to kill someone, as most of them come with some pretty cool alt-fire modes (with the Rocket Launcher having the most combinations of these modes) which can solve many tough situations other players could place you in. The weapons include; The Impact Hammer / Chainsaw alteration (worst weapon in the game BY FAR), Enforcer Pistol (you can DUAL WIELD THESE MOTHERFUCKERS), Biorifle (Pretty useless, but best in confined areas), Minigun, Pulse Gun (You can shoot LIGHTNING with the alt fire mode), Razorjack (Shoot razors that bounce off walls and the alt fire mode can make them EXPLODE), ASMD Shock Rifle (Basically a plasma gun, has a really neat combo which allows you to make the alt-fire plasma ball explode creating a large explosion), Flak Cannon (Pray mercy for those on the recieving end of this weapon), Rocket Launcher (shoots sometimes guided rockets and also grenades, pretty good stuff), Sniper Rifle (alt fire just allows you to use the scope) and probably saved best to last... The Redeemer (a giant motherfucking bazooka which shoots guided nuclear warheads, either ways anyone you fire this at is fucked). These weapons are fantastic and define most of the game's actions.

The gamemodes are really cool on this game, you could be spending hours playing on classic Deathmatch and Team Deathmatch, have great time humiliating the enemy team on Capture The Flag, run around the match capturing points in Domination, liberating bases from the enemy team's hands in Assault and finally see who will survive last in Last Man Standing. These game modes can be enhanced by mutators which can significantly change the gameplay of each gamemode.

The modding community, still active appaently and provides hundreds of new maps, mutators, character skins, weapons, voice packs for taunts, modding still makes this nearly 20 year old gem still feel fresh, not to mention they are all FREE so you don't have to pay for extra content when the community offers all of this extra content for free. The community itself is fantastic and helpful on the forums despite all the years that have went by.

Seriously there is so many awesome things I could talk about in this game which would've made this review even longer, but I give this game a solid 10/10 and would recommend this to anyone who wants to play an action packed FPS with friends or bots.

35552825.review:
[b][u]Puede que marque que solo jugué 9 horas, pero lo jugué muchísimo más antes de que lo tuviese en Steam y esas cosas.[/u][/b]

Esta es una crítica que hice en el año 2016, en esta critiqué el juego en distintos aspectos: Originalidad, Gráficos, Jugabilidad, Música/Otros y Conclusión.

[list]
[*][h1][b]ORIGINALIDAD 5/5[/b][/h1]
Una joya de los juegos multijugador. Se puede jugar solo (con bots o una "campaña"), multijugador. Posee varios modos de juegos (en uno incluso tienes un aparato para teletransportarte), una gran cantidad de mapas. Y una variedad de armas raras con distintos usos, y diseños "raros" (por así decirlo), la única semejante a un arma real sería la Minigun y la Enforce (debo decir que tuvieron bastante creatividad al crear las armas). 

[*][h1][b]GRÁFICOS 5/5[/b][/h1]
Para el año, nada de lo que quejarse. Tiene buenos gráficos, buenos mapas en 3D, los personajes se ven bien, y especialmente el diseño de las armas. 

[*][h1][b]JUGABILIDAD 5/5[/b][/h1]
La jugabilidad está perfecta, a mi parecer. El jugador tiene que ir acostumbrándose a los mapas mientras aprende los distintos usos de algunas armas, y con esto, además poder crear tácticas para el combate. 

[*][h1][b]OTROS 5/5[/b][/h1]
La trama gira que en el 2291 el gobierno crea unas ligas para un combate sin reglas, con el objetivo de frenar la violencia. Con esto supieron que era su mejor negocio, y crearon una liga de los profesionales, y somos elegidos para participar en esa liga. Si tengo que desatacar otra cosa, sería una obvia: La IA. De seguro es una de los mejores en sus tiempos, además de tener varias dificultados (desde novato, hasta maestro y godlike). Tal vez no es de las mejores, pero la OST es buena.
[/list]

[h1][b]CONCLUSIÓN[/b][/h1]
Para el año, el premio GOTY, y los demás premios que ganó, los tiene merecido. Pese a que ya tiene sus años, es uno de mis videojuegos favoritos, ya sea para jugar multijugador o solo. Si te gustan los shooters (y también los juegos viejos), de seguro este te encantará. Simplemente, perfecto.

34969832.review:
Never could get into quake 3. Weapons felt weak and didn't have much mechanics depth. But this game, sucked me in right on. Although I don't nowadays play the vanilla game really, more the numerous mods.

Pros:

- Wide weapon variety, only 3 conventional firearms. Two weapons you spawn with are a pretty potent and satisfying sounding pistol, secondarily a pneumatic hammer device that can be used for jumping higher than without and it can deflect projectiles with the altfire. Third weapon shoots globs of volatile and sticky green goo, secondary fire loads up a larger glob that travels very painfully slow but can turn opposition inside out in a single hit. 4th weapon is a fully automatic plasma gun, altfire however is a cutter beam that is seriously deadly if you can keep aim on a frantically moving enemy. Fifth weapon is a minigun. Primary fire is slow but remains accurate on any range, secondary fire spews bullets madly but has high spread. Sixth weapon shoots sharp discs that are a one hit kill if they hit neck. Secondary fire has them explode on contact, handy for example so that you can push enemies over a ledge. Seventh weapon is a cumbersome shotgunish thing that shoots instead of pellets, about fist sized metal chunks. Secondary fire tosses the whole shell, it explodes on contact. Eighth one is a good old rocket launcher whose explosions seriously throw an enemy around nicely. Altfire lobs the rockets aa grenades. Ninth weapon is a sniper rifle. Nuff said. Last one is a mininuke missile launcher. Whoa, I wrote a book.

- Bots' AI is impressive.

- Lots of mods of all types kinds. I recommend Nali Weapons 3, Excessive Unreal 2, Xidia, Seven Bullets and Operation Na Pali.

- Great map design. Most maps have beautiful scenery yet still perfect placement of pickups and smooth "flow".

- Gunplay. While I told about the weapons already, what they do each, I didn't mention that they are satisfying to shoot. Loud and clear sounds. Proper viewshake.

- Variety of gamemodes. Capture the flag, deathmatch, tdm. Then the less conventional ones are Assault which is an objective game mode, where attacking team must achieve the end goal before time runs out, and defenders have to prevent them from doing so. Another is Domination where you must set a control point to be in your team's control, then you start scoring every few seconds points. 

Cons:

- PVP isn't terribly active anymore..

- Eula agreement bullshit?

- Not really quite the GOTY edition, this release.

This is my favorite game of all time. Between the nostalgia and the maps I love this game inside and out.

The maps are amazing.
The music is great and atmospheric.
The weapons are unforgettable.

Especially if you grew up with this game. 
Although it doesn't particually have a story, but for me and others who are not exactly fond of story driven games are going to have more fun with instant action!

Also I reccomend to download the "NALIweapons3" mod made for it. You wont regret it.
You can also customize the bots to your liking and it's always amusing to call your bots stupid names and watch as the consol comes up with "You killed pizza" or something along the lines. 

The cheats can also be fun to mess around with, but I reccomend not playing the normal game with them on. It might ruin the fun.

Overall I love this game: it's a great shooter, Great to look at, and just loads of fun!

34278494.review:
UT – это "the alpha and the omega".

Если оригинальный Unreal 98 года заменил мне отца, подарив целый мир пиксельных чудес и межгалактических открытий, то Unreal Tournament стал подобен старшему брату, постоянно испытывающему меня и мои нервы на прочность. Битва с Ханом (да, я в курсе, что он Ксан, но уж как приелось) до сих пор вызывает дрожь в коленках, а победа над кибердемоном Анрила является идеей фикс, гораздо более значимой, чем простой киллстрик в матче против реальных людей. Когда я была маленькой и только-только осваивала шутер, фраза "Fear me!" действительно вызывала страх, ха-ха, что за чудесные были времена. Зачитываясь описаниями локаций и команд перед боем, я чувствовала прекрасную возможность расширить свои знания о вселенной, а не просто разбавить адскую мясорубку вереницей ненужного текста. И если для многих открытие жанра началось именно с UT, я же видела в нём испытательный полигон перед главной битвой против скааржей, так как первая часть франшизы была и остается моей любовью навека. Только потом паззл собрался воедино, показав, что UT является продолжением U98 и, собсна, результатом вторжения инопланетной расы на Землю.

Что касается технической части, UT полностью удовлетворяет всем требованиям шедевра. К каждой карте команда разработчиков подходила с особой любовью, создавая то величественные храмы, то казалось бы, довольно простенькие Deck16 и Facing Worlds, при виде которых сейчас накатывают острые приступы ностальгии. Треки были написаны композиторами, которых я не постесняюсь назвать Моцартом и Вивальди века электронной музыки. Система киллов (знаменитое m-m-monsterkill) тоже была разработана специально для UT, а в наши дни используется повсеместно, даже в Доте. Стоит ли упоминать про бесконечные фишки с телепортацией? Телефраги? Дух захватывает, когда видишь, что способен провернуть профессионал, вооруженный одним транслокатором. Почти все фундаменатальные основы сетевых шутеров были заложены в UT, и геймера, не признающего или не знакомого с Королем горы, давно пора обвинять в ереси.

Вас можно назвать потерянным для общества, если гневные восклики ботов и их рапорты в чате вас радуют больше, чем фразы реальных людей, случайно забредших на сервер. Знакомо? Тогда добро пожаловасть в семью! Оставь надежду, всяк берущий в руки Shock rifle.

Greatest first person shooter ever made.  Played this like crazy when I was younger.  

Definitely get this if its on sale, I scored it for $2.  The reason I say that, is there is some difficulty getting this game to run properly on modern machines.  When I first bought this game, I was running a Windows 8 machine.  I could start the game, the intro video would load all weird, then I could attempt to play, but once the actual gameplay launched the mouse didn't work and I was stuck spinning and staring at the ground or something.  Completely unplayable and never found a fix.

Fast forward to more recently, I have a different machine now running Windows 10 and I tried to get it running on this one.  It does not run perfectly, as the intro video is still all messed up, but when I enter the match things run solid.  Took some tweaking with resolution settings and stuff to get it to run how I wanted.

So just a heads up, as I do recommend the game, get it on sale, as there is no guarantee you may be able to get it running correctly, and may take a lot of work and research to do so.  You may be disappointed if you can't get it to run, but if you only paid $2 for it who cares.

33808567.review:
Bitesize Review - Unreal Tournament

The Good:
- Great Art Style
- Graphics still look Great
- Runs well on modern systems (sometimes too well, see below)
- Gameplay is still really fun, tons to choose from, and addicting
- Bots, game modes, and modifiers keep the game interesting
- Iconic and varied roster of weapons to choose from
- Tons of maps (like dozens and dozens)
- Music is perfect for the mood of the game and sounds great

The Bad:
- Some modern computers may require a patch or two to slow down the game so it does not play too fast!
- Single player is really just bot matches with some text story, so you might as well just play bot matches

The Verdict:
As you can tell I have a lot of love for this game. In fact I have to think hard just to find some fault with it. It really is one of the highlights of 90s shooters, and I could say that very few games released since then have even come close to providing the same level of quality and quantity of things to do as this game. 

The graphics are colourful and still look great, there are so many levels, characters, settings/modifiers for matches, game modes, and guns to play with. Back then game companies really wanted the player to have everything and this is one of the last great games where they thought about the gamer first. The only issue with this game really is that modern system may run it SO fast that you’ll actually have to download a patch or two to slow the game down so your character doesn’t run 100 times faster than they should.

I cannot recommend this game enough, it provides so much content and plays so well. If you enjoy old school shooters this is a must and it will offer you hours and hours of fun.

33022855.review:
The earliest incarnation of multiplayer FPS couldn't have had a better start. Surprisingly [b]Unreal Tournament[/b] still holds up today and i'm [i]stoked[/i]! Even though the online multiplayer is long dead but i already expected that from the get-go given the age of the game and the plethora of other more popular FPS.

Luckily you can still play against bots and you can set a high difficulty which provides a decent challenge if you're so inclined to enjoy this game again. You can pick from the basic game modes like deathmatch, capture the flag, assault, etc. and you get to choose from a good range of maps. 

But by far, my favorite thing about Unreal Tournament are the pre-loaded modifiers which create a whole new element to gameplay that still keeps me coming back i.e. zero gravity, one-shot kill, etc.. At the time this came out it was awesome and IMHO it still is! I still have clear memories burned deep of hours spent just zoning out on the maps and the soundtrack... oh the feels!

Maps like Facing Worlds for Capture the Flag, and Morpheus for Zero Gravity Deathmatch are the prime reason why i went ahead and purchased Unreal Tournament on here and i can't tell you how happy i am that it runs like a dream!

Funny enough, as much as i played the early multiplayer FPS's like Unreal Tournament and Quake 3 Arena... there are still a number of maps that i never touched on here. Definitely rectifying that!

[h1]===== VERDICT =====[/h1]

If you want to see where the origins of multiplayer FPS came from and actually be able to enjoy it in a visual setting that still holds up, you need to just get this game and have a go at it. 

Mind you, it's easy to dismiss Unreal Tournament given its age and how today we're used to better graphics, and the concept of multiplayer [b]bots[/b] isn't so acceptable nowadays when the alternative of playing online is available, but it's really not too shabby at all! Definitely worth it for you to give it a try!

M-M-M-M-MONSTER KILL!!!!

32866080.review:
Jogo esse clássico desde 2000. Mesmo após o lançamento das versões mais atuais (UT 2003, UT2004 e UT3), essa versão continua sendo minha predileta! Quem é das antigas lembra que esse jogo se tornou um clássico por, apesar dos gráficos belos, não precisar de uma placa 3D (como nós chamávamos as placas de vídeo dedicadas Voodoo da 3DFX).
Grande variedade mapas e armas, além de muitos mutators disponíveis para download.
Hoje, apesar de antigo, o jogo não fica atrás de games atuais em gráficos, pois a unreal tecnology permite qualquer resolução no game e existem patchs para corrigir os possíveis bugs das novas resoluções, então não deixe de comprar por causa que achou os gráficos mostrados nas fotos do game feios, pois elas não representam o jogo.
A física do jogo é muito boa e com poquissímos bugs.
Quanto ao multiplayer, sem dúvida em minha opinião é o FPS mais divertido que existe! Sempre joguei mais via LAN (até porque no ano 2000 banda larga era coisa de boy, e quando deixou de ser era 256 kbps) porém sei que existem vários servidores online, mesmo o jogo sendo antigo. É um jogo que em minha adolescência fazia com que todo final de semana fossemos com os CPU debaixo do braço (Não! Não tinhámos notebooks!) montar o frag na casa de um. Hoje eu e minha esposa ainda nos divertimos muitas horas jogando em multiplayer.
Também vale citar o singleplayer. A inteligência artifical do jogo é impressionante. Porém o jogo tem vários níveis de dificuldade, nos quais um iniciante em FPS poderá se sentir motivado a jogar o game, até o temido "Godlike" que torna os bots verdadeiros demônios até pra grandes gamers.
Por fim, pra não ficar só elogios, vale dizer que para a versão do Steam ficou faltando a expansão dos mapas, mutator e mod o CHAOSUT, porém é facilmente encontrado pra download e também pode ser instalado através de quem possui o CD original (e se o seu computador novo tiver drive de CD =D). Também ficou faltando a ofina Steam, pois garanto que muito dos Gamers são verdadeiros artistas na criação de mapas.

31627758.review:
[i]„Dostanu tě, bote!“[/i]

Zápas začíná, v celé aréně jsme čtyři, ale vyhrát může jenom jeden. Snažím se rychle získat nějakou zbraň, hned za prvním rohem, však dochází k úvodnímu střetnutí. Oba jsme nepřipraveni, spouštíme tak zoufalý štěkot našich Enforcerů... „First Blood!“, začíná to slibně. Má radost ale netrvá dlouho, zvuky střelby přilákaly dalšího soupeře s Minigunem, stačilo jen krátké polechtání. Při druhém pokusu získávám Shock Rifle, do protější místnosti tak posílám kuličku plazmy a následně ji protínám paprskem – „Double Kill!“. Třetí pokus končí mojí ustřelenou hlavou. Při čtvrtém však získávám Shield Belt a Flak Cannon, drásající střepiny neznají slitování: „Killing Spree!“. Po litém boji nakonec obsazuji druhou příčku, nevadí. Okamžitě spouštím novou hru – zápas začíná, v celé aréně jsme čtyři, ale vyhrát může jenom jeden...

Na konci roku 1999, již nebylo pochyb o tom, že on-line střílečky čeká slibná budoucnost. Vedle jedné [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/10/CounterStrike/]populární modifikace[/url], totiž vyšla očekávaná akce od id Software, s názvem [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/2200/Quake_III_Arena/]Quake III Arena[/url]. Pozadu ale nezůstalo ani studio Epic Games, které pod taktovkou Cliffa Bleszinského (Jazz Jackrabbit, Gears of War), vydává svůj Unreal Tournament. V té době, u nás bylo hraní po internetu ještě nedosažitelné sci-fi. Musel jsem se proto spokojit s režimem pro jednoho hráče, který je však nadmíru zábavný i po těch sedmnácti letech. Vaším cílem je vyhrát všechny části turnaje a stát se tak nepřemožitelným šampionem. Bojuje se v těchto disciplínách: Deathmatch (všichni proti všem), Domination (obsazování klíčových bodů), Capture the Flag (boj o vlajku) a Assault (dobývání území).

Map je v součtu 45 a všechny nabízejí zběsilou akci, kde nejde ani tak o chirurgicky přesné míření, jako spíš o efektivní využívání dostupných prostředků. Vedle různých posilovačů zdraví a odolnosti, jsou to především dva módy střelby všech zbraní, umožňující pohotové řešení každé situace. Odpovídá tomu i výrazná členitost arén, šikovně kombinující volná prostranství s úzkými koridory, udržující hráče neustále ve střehu. Povedený je také skvěle padnoucí hudební doprovod, stejně jako pestrá škála zvolených prostředí. Těšit se můžete na tajemné chrámy, opuštěné továrny, středověké hrady, či kosmické stanice. Ale nemusíte mít strach, nikdy tam nebudete sami. Celou dobu vám bude dělat společnost démonický hlasatel, stejně jako jízlivé poznámky vašich soupeřů... „Try a bigger gun!“

Pokud si tedy chcete připomenout jednu z povedených stříleček svojí doby, pak máte mé doporučení.

[i][url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6861342/]Další recenze na mé kurátorské stránce[/url][/i]

I got this for Christmas one year when I was about 13 or so.  Kinda suprised my mom bought me a game this violent and for a holiday that celebrates the birth of Christ...  But she was right for doing so, because this game is a classic and a masterpiece.  It's indisputable.  I feel so fortunate to have experienced this game.  I remember getting the 100MB demo on my 28k connection after days of trying, installing it, and feeling like I just pulled excalibur out of stone.

And wow...  It doesn't only look good through nostalgia goggles.  It doesn't just look good "for its time."  I have been playing it today, and I am in awe at how well it stacks up against games being released today.  Sure, there are a few less polygons, but the same levels that used to wow me back in 2000 in this game still amaze me today.

Music, sound effects (the classic "headshot!"), mechanics, gameplay.  Everything is 10/10 about this game.

30081691.review:
Even after almost 20 years, the original UT remains a satisfying run-and-gun arena shooter with a ton of quirky weapons and interesting levels. There's no questioning it's harder on the eyes than its competitor from the era, Quake III, but it also had more gameplay modes, more features, and better bots than Quake III did, which is why it captured my attention in a way the admittedly purer shooting experience of Quake III never did. In addition to the bots, UT also had the better campaign mode, if for no other reason than the aforementioned variety.

The sequels certainly each had their merits - who doesn't love running people over with the absurd vehicles in 2004? - but the 1999 original will always hold a place in my heart, both for nostalgic and earnestly-held gameplay reasons.

29177862.review:
Ох, привет классика! Помню когда вышел ещё первый Unreal и по телевизору рекламировали вовсю ускорители 3DFX, по РТР показывали Маски-Шоу, по ТНТ  тогда моя старенькая Riva tnt 4 mb не тянула эту игру. Компьютер был скромный Cyrix 300 mhz, оперативки 8 mb, хард на 4 гига. В те времена игры занимали от 400-800 мегабайт и приходилось думать, перед тем как ставить, тогда Unreal у меня так страшно лагал, кадр в секунду хах, делаешь шаг и ждёшь секунд десять, а поиграть жесть как хотелось, особенно когда я прочитал про игру в журнале Страна Игр или это была Игромания не помню уже, а затем увидел по телеку рекламу игры в программе "От Винта", жесть как захотел её. Были великие игры Quake 1-2, Starcraft, Hexen 3D, Half-Life 1 и Оpossing force длс и т.д. Когда я апгредил свой ПК купив процессор Селерон 566 мгц и разогнал его до 700, видюха уже была riva tnt 2 na 16 mb, оперативы было 32 мб, вот тогда я начал вовсю играть в новинки тех времён. Прошло время и я зашёл как-то в магазин и увидел Unreal Tournament в переводе от Фаргус и сразу же купил. Вот это были деньки, рубился днями напролёт, прошёл на всех сложностях, командовал ботами и вообще обожал эту игру и ту озвучку. Тогда уже на заре 2001, между одноклассниками мы постоянно спорили, что лучше, Квака 3 или Унреал: турманент. Я часто аргументировал что А:Т лучше ибо больше режимов и карты красивее, но увы в комп. клубах везде стояли КС и Квака. Я тогда ещё КС играл старый, 1,1 кажется версия была, еще диски продавались с ботами, реалбот и т.д., ботам прописывал их слова в чат и сложность. Тогда ещё наткнулся на Fallout 2, Baldurs Gate 2, Max Payne. Это не просто божественная игра, тут боты при хороших настройках были как люди, реагировали быстро, в чате базарили, матерились, кричали, просили помощи, как будто с людьми играешь, еще их можно было со спины обойти и пока они тебя не увидят лицом, они не видят тебя, также если по ним стреляешь и убегаешь, они в погоню бросаются. А карты это вообще шикардос вкупе с динамичной музыкой, это просто было нечто. 

Эта игра напоминает мне те светлые времена, когда мы ходили в комп.клубы, читали игровые журналы, смотрели "От Винта" по НТВ, Симпсонов по Рен-ТВ, Геракла с Зеной по НТВ, ждали GTA - 3, ибо мечтали увидеть в 3д мир ГТА. Мечтали о 3-д стратегиях в мире C&C и Warcrafta, играя в BattleZone, Uprusing, Total Annihilation. Спорили часто, гугла не было и было много выдуманных легенд бродивших в народе, мобил тоже не было, шли к другу в гости наугад, просто, без причины, позвать поиграть, если его не было дома, то спрашивали куда он пошёл и шли туда и в 99% находили его там. В те времена игры были хардкорными и спасибо отдельное Fargus за их работу, ведь до них приходилось играя в Myst или какой-нибудь квест держать около себя справочник по английскому и переводить текста, чтобы понять задание или смысл. Сейчас по прошествии 16 лет, я снова запустил эту игру и как будто снова оказался в том  наивном и невинном времени, боты всё также сильны, поставил предпоследнюю сложность, загнобили меня, уже не та реакция, как в детстве). Купил как дань, тому времени и благодарность разработчикам, всем спасибо за внимание.

Long before CoD and BF franchises existed..

The golden age of FPS games: Wolfenstein, Doom, Quake, and Unreal.
Unreal eventually added multiplayer, becoming Unreal Tournament '99.

These games had no kill streaks, no customizable classes, no "$20 dlc", no bullshit.
You had to have skill to win.

Think you're good?  Set the AI to inhuman (or godlike if you want a real spanking).
This game doesn't forgive mistakes.  (If you're insane, enable instagib.)

(I have admin'd a few UT servers off and on.. over the years.)

TLDR: A real FPS game. (Worth it!)
CoD/BF newbies need not apply.

29121040.review:
First off, BUY THIS GAME. If you like shooters, then this game is already perfect. Even if you aren't playing this for nostalgia, its still an amazing game. It honestly became my favorite FPS game. I will do a simple Pros/Cons list. 


*PROS* 

+Very High Fun factor

+Diversity in guns/Pick-ups

+Good soundtrack, but the sound effects on each weapon feels awesome

+Playing against bots is actually really fun because how well coded they are to actually be a good healthy challenge

+THE MAP DESIGN IS PERFECT, each game mode has unique maps that are always fun to explore and learn

+The visuals/graphics are  very pleasing. Yes the game is from 1999, but the environments look great. Each weapon has awesome particle effects that still impress. 

+Can run on pretty much every computer, so if you are a person with a slower computer I'm almost certain that this game will run just fine with very smooth frame rates. (If you experience lag, try minimizing it and just stretch it out to full screen on the window, for some reason when I ran it on my shit laptop the only way I was able to fix it was that)

*CONS* 
-Multiplayer community isn't very active, but there are still people are playing it. 


Overall : 9.75 Must buy game.

28810208.review:
Unreal Tournament (a.k.a. UT99, or "holy shit the memories!") is one of the most popular games in the FPS Arena genre. Even though released in 1999, it still holds up pretty well nowadays, and still works on modern systems with some minor tweakings.

+ UT is very competitive, fast-paced, frenetic, and technically impressive for its time. It rewards players with decent accuracy, awareness and coordination. It offers a good amount of maps (each having different areas and layouts) and a good range of guns that are pretty unique from each other, with each having both primary and secondary firing modes. 
+ Apart from the usual Deathmatch and Team Deathmatch modes, there are also more different gamemodes such as the objective-based Assault gamemode, Capture the Flag, Domination and Last Man Standing.
+ Obviously not graphically impressive nowadays, but the high-quality sound effects and soundtrack help shape the overall atmosphere of the game, making it darker but more life-like at the same time.
+ While UT is mainly a multiplayer-centered game, it can still certainly be enjoyable offline thanks to the smart, challenging and customizable AI bots, with also the ability to host private listen servers for your friends.

Heck, when I'm struggling to find any cons, that means a lot... wether you're an online or offline player, it's well worth the purchase.

28587983.review: The first time i played this was as a kid at lan party in a basement. I was horrible at it but this game is the reason i play video games today. I actually made my steam account just so i would always have access to it since i had lost my disc a long time. I recently just bought a steam machine and windows 10 just so i could play this game. The new unreal tournament just doesn't satisfy the hunger for this game (The new one is still pretty awsome tho). Running on windows 10 was really simple by using the opengl as my renderer. I picked Direct3d at the initial setup and it did not work (super buggy, low frames, completely unplayable). Everything i googled about running on windows 10 required downloading drivers or messing with the files by copy and pasting into the unrealtournament.ini. I decided to give opengl a try before trying anything crazy and now it runs better than I remembered. Its not as fast as quake but its fast compared to alot of popular fps titles. If you love halo multiplayer or doom 2016 multiplayer you will fall in love with this classic. Steam gives you the 436 version. I wouldnt recommend connecting to random servers as they will download files to your computer. 28352255.review:
It's a multiplayer first person shooter that, unfortunately, has not aged well.

The main problem is that the game is so old the multiplayer community died off a long time ago. There is no single player campaign, although you can play single player against bots.

EDIT: There are a series of organized botmatches against bots, with the next botmotch only being unlocked when you beat the current one. I don't really consider this to be a single player campaign in the conventional sense, as the story is minimal, there are no single-player specific levels or enemies, and the levels are just the standard multiplayer levels. However based on the comments to this review some people do consider this to be a "single player campaign."

The bots are decent opponents but lack variety in their behavior - once you've learned their moves they aren't much of a threat.

There's a variety of different game types to keep things fresh, everything from standard Deathmatch to Capture the Flag. Also many of the maps were quite innovative in their design -- one takes place on a speeding train, for example. 

It was a great, trailblazing game when it first came out but now in 2016 I can't really recommend it.

A groundbreaking first-person shooter which codified an entire subgenre alongside it's contemporary Quake III. 

Still very easy to pick up and play, even today (although of course a few keybinds need to be changed).

27996695.review:
Still as much fun today as it was back when it was first released. Truly a game that stands the tests of time.

A frantic, fast-paced FPS that's filled with action. High game speed, little to no cover, and very few places to hide. The weapons are quite unique and with each weapon having 2 firing modes, the different playstyles one can adopt are plenty. A game that is still a lot of fun to play competitive against your friends in.

The amount of game modes offered are decent enough, considering its age. Most are pretty standard game modes that one usually expects from games with competitive multiplayer, but it does offer some that stand out such as Assault. It also has a fair amount of maps, most of which are very memorable and iconic. There are also a lot of fan made custom maps that are easy to put into the game.

27755581.review:
I am usually quite ambiguous when it comes to evaluating games; even the most critically acclaimed game may fall down into the mire from the right perspective (looking at you FO4). However there are a select few games which I would consider "Must Plays". Games so important and timeless that - provided you have any interest in the genre what-so-ever - you have to own. Oblivion would be such a game for the open-world genre, Dawn of War for the RTS genre. Why? Neither game is perfect by any means, but they are landmarks, marking turning points and signifying a leap forwards.

The FPS genre could have a number of games put forwards for this presitgious honour, but for reasons which shall soon become apparent, the only real contender is Unreal Tournament.

UT99 as it shall be referred to from here on, marked the modernisation of a format which had been in the making for several years. Quake 3 Arena was a popular alternative but play Quake 3 now, and while it is still thoroughly enjoyable, it feels old. It still has the terrible animations, the clinically un-atmospheric environments, the soapy aftertaste of a game lacking in passion and excitement.

UT99 put all of this right. The levels were beautifully designed and characterful, with each and every square inch dripping with details and offering a plethora of combat options. Every weapon had its own personality, there was no progression or advancement from one to the next; just a change in options. Even the characters each had sparks of life in their eyes. But what really set it apart from the rest of the pack was the music. Without the music, UT99 would have been a great game. But the soundtrack elevated it up to the prestigious podium of mastercrafted perfection.

UT99 set new standard for combat, level design, graphic capability, combat scale and bot intelligence. However it's use of  musical scores changed the way games would be designed forever. UT99's stablemates in its year of release almost uniformly did away with soundtracks, save for the occasional musical score. In the year following its release, soundtracks became more common, especially noticable in games like No One Lives Forever and Hitman. Go forwards just one more year, and games such as Halo and Serious Sam join the fray. Both very different games, but what do they have in common? Iconic soundtracks.

UT99 is a fundementally vital game for the advancement of the FPS and the arena shooter, and it deserves its place in the halls of fame (and your library) for that alone. However the next time you notice the musical atmosphere in a game, remember that you have this game to thank.

27692758.review:
This was the first PC game I've ever played back in 2000, I tried to play it with a joystick, that was a mistake, and then I grabbed the mouse and it was the most fun I've ever had up to that point.

This was a really early multiplayer twitch shooter with offline modes as well. Some of the things that made this game stand out was the taunts that let your character talk smack to the other team every time you got a kill and it also had a really great soundtrack that got you moving while you play, something a lot of multiplayer games are lacking these days.

Most surprising of all is how active the multiplayer community still is, after you load up the browser list with dedicated servers you can still find a lot of full or nearly full matches to play, its a game that's never going to die.

For those wondering, it supports widescreen and has no issues in Windows 10. Just make sure to choose Direct3D rendering as all the other modes are obsolete.

27625089.review:
"М-м-монстроидальная ностальгия
Студенческая общага, отдельно взятая комната. Все на разных специальностях, у каждого свой круг общения, свои вкусы и интересы. Игры в основном довольно свежие — один часами выносит мид, второй может до утра сидеть на сайте с флеш-играми, третий предпочитает отстреливать кровососов на Зоне, четвёртый в лице серба-уголовника терроризирует американский мегаполис… В общем, по вечерам комната превращалась в дурдом.

Захотелось мне на днях вспомнить детство. Добыл «Нереальный турнир» 1999 года, поставил, бегаю…

— Unreal?

— Угу…

— Дай установщик!

Спустя пятнадцать минут:

— А давай по сети?

— Давай!

Бегаем вдвоём, синхронно материмся. Один из соседей отрывается от монитора:

— Что это у вас? Unreal?

— Он самый.

— А дайте установщик!

Через двадцать минут синхронного мата становится больше. Выходит из мида третий:

— Народ, что здесь происходит? Вы по сетке рубитесь?

— Да, вот флешка с установщиком. Присоединяйся!

Сетевые бои быстро стали традицией.

А сегодня к нам аккурат во время очередного заруба пришли соседи — ярые поклонники танковых боев:

— Народ, ну что за дела?! Вы каждый вечер материтесь! Вы уже зае… (Пауза.) Unreal?

— (Хором.) Да!

— А дайте… (В сторону просителей летят сразу две флешки.) Эмм, спасибо.

Через двадцать минут из-за гипсокартонной перегородки, которую здесь почему-то называют стеной, начинают доноситься подозрительно знакомые звуки.

Воистину, классика вечна!"

Не знаю насколько достоверна эта старенькая история, но в эта игра действительно затягивает по сей день. Даже если играешь с ботами.

27480316.review: Игра-легенда. Игра, проверенная временем. Игра, которая от целой прорвы сетевых шутеров выгодно отличается рядом достоинств. Потрясающая атмосфера, великолепная внешность (это касается не только, и не сколько графики, передовой на момент выхода, но и шикарного дизайна), огромное количество режимов игры, отличное оружие (оно не только хорошо ощущается и им приятно убивать, оно стильное и, порою, оригинальное, а главное - разнообразное). У игры огромная куча достоинств, которые невозможно перечеркнуть временем. Но лично для себя я выделяю главное - это саундтрек. Редко в какой игре музыка настолько великолепна и так влияет на геймплей. А для сетевого шутера такое - вообще, к сожалению, редкость. В Unreal Tournament музыка - это львиная доля атмосфера и стиля, задавая приятный тон, она шикарно ложиться на динамику геймплея. Я могу назвать много игр с хорошим дизайном, с хорошим геймлпеем или передовой на момент выхода графикой. Но мало в каких играх я буду с такой любовью вспоминать саундтрек.

Одна из первых игр, с которой началось мое знакомство с прекрасным миром компьютерных  игр.

А в общем это, на мой взгляд, один из классических 3D-шутеров, лежащий у начала целого направления.

Рекомендовать ли эту игр?
Если вы начали играть гораздо позже 1999-2000 годов, если вы избалованы современной графикой - то вам она может непонравиться.

27419365.review:
Klasika ktorá ma vždy vie pobavit, asi jediná hra okrem C&C Generals ktorú si viem zahrať aj po rokoch.
Hra nás zavedie do budúcnosti v ktorej žijú rôzni mutanti, roboti a k prekvapeniu aj ľudia. Obsahuje nadpriemernú grafiku (Písal sa rok 1999 ked bola táto hra novinkou), široké možnosti gameplayu od Kampane ktorá je vlastne pozliepaná z jednotlivých módov [list] [*][b]Deathmatch[/b] Ide o to zabiť čo najviac hráčov v určenom čase, alebo ako prvý dosiahnuť počet zabitých protihráčov. [*][b]Domination[/b] tu sa snažíte obsadzovať nepriateľské plochy vyznačené "laserovým" obrazcom ktorý zmení farbu ked cez neho prejdete, čím viac obrazcov pod kontrolou máte tým rýchlejšie body získavate. [*][b]CTF[/b] Capture the flag je vlastne o tom že sa snažíte ukradnúť vlajku nepriateľskému teamu a musíte ju doručit k tej svojej. [*][b]Assault[/b] konečne nejaké misie. Dostanete za úkol sa prebíjat cez úseky (checkpointy) ktoré vás v prípade zabitia posunú o krok bližšie k splneniu úkolu (zničenie lode, ovládnutie vlaku atd...) [*][b]Challenge[/b] hráte proti najlepším z najlepších (robotom) a máte tu aj bossa pri ktorom ma chytal rage.[/list] Za splnenie každej zložky kampane získavate medailu, ktorá sa pekne renderuje v miestnosti aj s Vaším superherom. Trofej sa efektne zjaví prostredníctvom teleportu na stĺpiku jej vyhradenému. Každý mód má teda svoj vlastný stĺpik a najvyšší hneď za hráčvom má najvyššiu cenu, poslednú trofej získate nakopaním prdele robotickému bossovi na ktorého meno si už ale nespomeniem.

Okrem challenge viete všetky misie nájst pod položkou "practice sesion" čo v podstate znamená tréning. Tu si viete navyše navolit aj [b]Team deathmatch[/b] kde sa hry môžu zúčastniť až štyri teamy (červený,  modrý, žltý, zelený) a zabíjate hráčov ostatných teamov. Fragy vašeho teamu sa sčítavajú a vpravo ukazuje ktorý team koľko ľudí/robotov zabil.
V practice session si viete nastaviť neskutočne veľa máp (moja najoblúbenejšia je [b]Facing worlds[/b]), viete tu nastaviť každého bota individuálne (od jeho vzhladu, teamu, hlasu až po jeho štýl a úroveň), maplist (aktívne mapy), mutators (viete si tu nastaviť zaujímavosti ako to že priberáte keď máte veľa fragov a chudnete ked ich máte málo :D , ringopílu, veľkú hlavu, neviditelnosť, paprskomet ktorý Vás rozšlahá na jednu šupu, a kopec dalších)

Hra je to ceľkom zábavná, boti vydávajú super hlášky, niekedy aj zvuky (hlavne keď umierajú), efekty sú pôsobivé je tu model kompletného rozpadu teľa napríklad po zásahu raketou a tie zvuky padajúceho mäsa no musím sa smiať :D hra je to každopádne zábavná, obsahuje aj multiplayer kde k prekvapeniu sú stále niektoré servery aktívne aj po 17 rokoch odkedy hra vyšla ....

Neviem či si hra nájde hráčov aj v dnešnej dobe plnej nabušenej grafiky a prázdnych príbehov, ale hráčom z mojej generácie pripomína časy čo tu bolo pred Counter Strike (ktorý už stojí zaprd) ...

I've played this masterpiece of a game since 1999, and always enjoyed it. What hours I have here is nothing compared to how much I played it before I got the steam version.

Pros:
- It has great single/multi player gameplay.
- The technology (graphics/sound/animations/...) were cutting edge in 1999, and It never looked bad to me until this day (to each his own of course). :)
- Decent game mods. It has everything a multiplayer FPS game was supposed to offer in those golden days.
- Runs smooth in every windows or graphic card I tried it.
- Extremely polished game.
- Sometimes in a game everything gets messed up in a section of the map, and everybody is shooting others, with 10 different types of bullets flying in the air! These chaos moments of UT was one of the best things in the history of gaming! lol
- Multiplayer still has players after 17 years!
- Better than Quake III! lol

Cons:
- It's not the GotY edition that Epic released back then (with all the extra maps and weapons and farts and the lolz).

All in all, [b]gold never gets outdated, does it? <3 [/b]

27206764.review:
If nominating this game in freaking TWENTY-SIXTEEN for a steam award *(Steam being something that did not exist until 2003) doesn't speak volumes for the high regard in which I hold this game, I'm not sure if anything else I say will convince you.  But here goes:

Multiplayer:  Is insane.  And very customisable, especially given it's age.  So if you want to put 24 players into a map designed for a max of 6 and make every weapon a rocket launcher, go for it.  Want every gun to insta-kill and every player be invisible?  This game invented that.  Don't have even teams?  Put a few bots in, they have an option to scale their difficulty to that of the players.  Low-gravity & optinal item power-ups?  These are options from a game that was made in 1999.

Single Player:  Arguably as good as playing multiplayer, and that's BANANAS.  There are 5 different tournaments to win (1 for every play-mode, Deathmatch/Team Deathmatch/Domination/CTF/Assault) and that's plobably about 10 hours of gameplay already.  Assault in particular is like finding there's a rumpus room in a house you've been living in for a year and only just found out about.  Then there is also custom games where you can fill any map with AI players.  These bots can be customised to have names, favourite weapons, be aggressive or cowardly, more accurate or less accurate, and to have varying awareness levels.

Weapons:  Best fps weapon design...maybe ever?  Every weapon has an alternate firing mode, and some have extra features on top of that, while still being completely accessible to a new player.  Take the Rocket Launcher;  Click fire once, fire one rocket.  Hold it down and it will load up to 6 rockets and fire them in a spread. If you follow a target for a few seconds before firing, your crosshair will change and that means you're locked on and your rockets will be homing. Hit right-click and you get a capped rocket instead that acts like a grenade.  Hold it down and it will load up to 6.  This is a single gun, and I'm not even joking when I say it's not overpowered, because every single weapon is just as deadly in it's own ways and thay all combine to be a ton of fun.

This game, at the time I write this, is less than $5.  Give it a shot.  I promise that if you look past graphics which are polygonal but far from unwatchable, this game will impress you.

26264867.review:
I just revisited this game because I had such good memories of it. The variety of game types, the variety of weapons, the beauty of the maps, and the bot AI makes it the ultimate competitive FPS. It's all about the Tournament. And there are so many different kinds of tournament games to play, against real people or bots.

What's also very nice is the ability to set up your own favourite kind of practice session, with bots of your choosing, on whatever map you want. So, for example, you can play capture the flag, you alone against a large army of stupid bots, or a single insanely good bot. Or you can have a bot team, and give them commands. Or you can just set up a bots-only competition, and just watch them go at it.
Unreal Tournament has no need for a story. It's no-fuss interface allows the game-player to immediately launch themselves into the 'Unreal Tournament'- a futuristic fight-to-the-death, and as more scenarios are completed, four other game formats are introduced. There's 'capture the flag', in which you lead a team of fighters in an attempt to capture the opposing team's flag, all while defending your own. Following that, there's 'domination', a somewhat boring format that has your team controlling as many 'point scorers' as possible in order to amass your growing total to a winning score. The most exciting format is 'assault', whereby your team infiltrates either a submarine or a moving train, or whatever, in order to satisfy a number of mission objectives, all under a given time period. 
And don't forget that the game screams on today's machines -- smooth as silk, and very pretty.

25300080.review:
Today, many games are received well, but few are remembered. Simply being "good" is not enough to make it as a "classic", and the telltale sign of a classic since time immemorial, is that the game starts amazing and remains amazing even as it ages. It's a quality that transcends even nostalgia.

Unreal Tournament (UT99), is one of those few "true classic" games. It's a genuine classic; among the pinnacle of shooters not only of its time, but of all FPS games ever made. The sheer versatility of the game engine, its incredible array of mods, the incredible depth and value of content that comes with just the base game...I do not exaggerate one bit when I say that nobody makes games of this quality and value anymore.

It isn't perfect, no game is, but in a game market historically plagued with style over substance design, UT99 managed to give us both in every way that matters. Single Player? LAN? Traditional net?
All available in half a dozen modes, with stellar AI support that only a tiny handful of games (let alone shooters) even attempt.

If there is any criticism I have of this game, it's that the Steam version is -NOT- the complete Game of the Year Edition, as it's missing the entire 2nd CD of content.
Much of the missing content can be found online for free as core updates or updates to mods.

(though you will be missing some Chaos UT maps; for some reason, their last version of Chaos UT99 didn't include all the maps in the GOTY edition. It's a shame because two phenomenal CTF maps are missing, and one of those also has one of best music tracks in UT:GOTYE)

Getting the game to run on newer computer systems requires only a little effort (I'm running on Win10 without issue), so barring GOG, there's no reason to not have this in your library.

Oh my lord the umpteen hours that I have played this game. I've got the original (twice - both base and GOTY), the GOG version and now purely because I can, the Steam version (as well as all the subsequent iterations).

NEVER in my life have I enjoyed a game as much as I enjoyed (still enjoy) this.

VERY few games have ever come close to the gladiatorial, visceral magnificence of this game but this did it properly first.

Weapons are still the very best in any game ever. The twin firing dynamic is used to utter perfection.

Graphics are now of course dated but still more than do the job and everything else still feels as fluid and fresh as the day it was released 16 years ago. 

The subsequent UT's are also nothing short of superb but this, this is just gaming PERFECTION and holds a place in my heart that nothing will ever replace. 

AI is great (very challenging on latter difficulties) and multiplayer is still the best experience ever created.

I have NEVER played a game that has held my attention for so long (apart from the c64 version of Paradroid and Mike Singletons Lords of Midnight and Doomdarks Revenge). 

It is a peerless FPS, it is magnificent, it is perfection.

There was always a dispute between which was better, this or Quake 3. I love both and my gaming life would not have been what it was without either but UT takes it because of the multitude of superb mods and maps created by the amazing gaming community. These add immeasurably to what is already a work of genius.

11 out of 10. Utterly, utterly superb in every way that a game can be.
 
As I said the later iterations are also brilliant but this gift from the gods is and always will be my favourite PC game of all time.

A game that my life has been enriched by through it's very existence. How many games (things generally) can you say that about ?

I've only played this game for 17 hours at the time of this writing, but I can safely say that this is one of the best shooters I've played in my time playing video games. 
Where even to start? All the guns perform great and are easy to use. The campaign is a biy meh, but the robustness of the matches you can create with the bots means you can sink hours into this just seeing how the matches will play out. There's well over 20 maps on offer here, which is something unheard of in the modern market. The graphics are simple and blocky, but are serviceable enough, and the music and sound effects are excellent. You can still play it online. I was able to find full servers for deathmatch even 17 years after the initial release. You can also mod it as much as you please, as the modding community is still active to this day. One mod I would suggest if you do this would be ChaosUT. It adds new maps and weapons, my personal favorite being the sword. This game is 10 dollars, and you could potentially get hundreds of hours of enjoyment out of it. So give it a shot, and see what shooters used to be like.

24413795.review:
You know there are things you loved as a kid but you go back to now and they're just not as good.  Campbell's Meatballs.  Angel Delight.  Jon Pertwee as Dr Who.

   Unreal Tournament is JUST as good as I remember.  Okay I'd have got it when I was in my twenties but 17 years makes this archaic in first persion shooter terms but it is still the neat brutal shooter I remember.

   Get your settings sorted out - this predates WASD.  Also turn the brightness up to max - the bots are too strong to try and play in the dark.  You have good control over your friendly Bots and the A.I. is a good balance of competent but fallible.

   The weapons mix is some of the best ever and armour comes directly from Doom - so very well balanced

    Opposing Worlds.  Man.  Sat in unearthly silence high above an alien world, the moons drifting in the background.  Shooting enemy bots dead with head shot after head shot from your sniper rifle.  GODLIKE !  Too right brother, too right.

    The later levels of Capture the Flag are still insanely deadlocked because since on death everyone respawns instantly at their home base even if you can battle your way into the enemy base alive it's virtually impossible to battle your way out again.  But Sub Pen is riotous fun for all that.

    This game was released when games came out as good as they were going to get - no DLC, no patches.  That 17 years later it STILL rates with the best is a testament to how good the developers were back then - and perhaps how their modern counterparts need to revaklue their priorities.

S.x.

. Вот он хит из моей жизни 1999 года, самая уникальная игра из всей серии Unreal от Epic Games. Игра давала отпор в конкуренции с Quake 3 Arena и на тот момент о CS и не было слова, так как Counter-Strike появился лишь к концу 2000 года и начал набирать популярность с 2002-ого. Как на тот момент во всю шпарили в динамичные и атмосферные игры. 

. С последующими выпусками игр от Epic Games - утратила дух первого Unreal Tournament, а название этой версии среди геймеров было дано UT99. Последующие версии начиная с UT2003 (которую убрали с рынка и оставили лишь 2004), не имеют той атмосферы и уникальности...

. Несмотря на время, игра её не утратила и до сих пор именно эта версия игры имеет не малое количество фанатов и до сих пор имеет большое количество серверов! Так же до сих пор фанаты клепают дополнения и "пользовательские" моды, которые создают большие возможности в игре и её разнообразия. Так не хватает этой игре достижений и мастерской Steam.

. [b]Убью 10 Ксанов (BOSS Xan) из 10. Игра по праву занимает свое первое место среди всех серий Unreal в этом игровом мире и стоит широкого внимания! Рекомендую всем пользователям Steam![/b]

24177114.review:
Short: A must-have classics of videogaming. Still totally worth playing today. 

Why to buy it: Historical masterpiece. Perfect for relaxation. It helps to find peace and emptiness after a hard day at work. More efficient than meditation, sauna, or sport. 

Long version:

Unreal Tournament has something magical. It has been years since its original release, and still, it's amazingly good and definitely worth playing. For those who do not know this ultimate legend of FPS, let me introduce it in a few lines :

Most FPS have tried to find a neat story to keep the player into the game. Then someone came and said: "Hey, guys, why do we care with a story? Don't we play only to shoot and have fun, after all?" And so came Unreal Tournament. The idea is that you are a gladiator in a futuristic universe, with some interesting background with appreciable ties with the Unreal universe. So you are in an arena with guns spread everywhere, and if you are killed, you just instantly respawn and continue the fight. It means there is no break, no searching for the way forward, for stupid opening buttons. You just fight and fight and fight endlessly, until you win the match. The experience was, and still remains, an extremely intense one. Videogame here is at its greater height, even if it's shear violence and barbarousness. 

Now, is it still worth today? The graphics have aged, for sure, but the level design was so good, that it doesn't matter a lot. They did not try to build magnificent open spaces areas in a luxurious nature: Most arenas are confined basements, and this is the kind of decor which cannot be much prettier today than it was seventeen years ago. Gameplay is still pretty much perfect. Weapons are sufficiently hidden so that you have to find out where they are while trying not being killed by those who already have them, and there is a good diversity of them. Everything was well-balanced then, and it has remained so up to now, as equilibrium never ages. 

What feels like the twentieth century, however, is the AI if you play solo, especially in Assault mode, where your team keeps following you, backing you up in the most useless manner. That means that if you are almost at the objective, and you die, you return to the starting point, and your team, instead of finishing what you were up to, just left the enemy base to greet you in pack at your respawn place. 

To end this review, I will tell you some personal story I have with this game. In my youth years I was often bullied by a big tough guy; but one day we spoke and, I don't know really how, we ended up by him lending me his Unreal Tournament game. I enjoyed it a lot, and now that we had a common enthralling to share, we became good lads and he never bullied me again. Peace among people can be achieved through cathartic  videogaming, it would seem.

Множество разнообразных карт, режимов игры и оружия, умные боты, надпись синим КЭШИРОВАНИЕ, мегакрутые и легендарные треки ("Та-да-да, та-да-да-да-да-да-да, туу-ду..."), много насилия, мутаторы, ругательства, настраиваемая внешность своего персонажа с выбором лица, тела и голоса, выписываемые противниками сальто, стабильные сервера без багов - всему этому немного мешают полигоны персонажей, но в остальном игра остается на уровне лучших сетевых шутеров всех времен, и я охотнее сыграю в нее, нежели в UT2004 и выше, которые у меня есть. И не только потому, что ностальжи и так далее, тут атмосфера есть, тут весело, черт возьми! Вот если б еще достиги сделали, было бы вообще офигенно...

23533440.review: I have to thank the DOOM 2016 open beta for introducing me to Unreal Tournament. I used to play DOOM 2 deathmatch over dialup when I was younger, and I was part of the Quake Alpha/Beta deathmatch trials back in the day. I loved online deathmatch, but went away from it for many years as FPS maps grew and gameplay slowed down. Playing DOOM 2016 deathmatch didn’t feel “right”, and the STEAM comments kept referring to Unreal as a much better online shooter experience. So I grabbed UT GOTY and the rest of the UT series. How right these commenters were….Unreal Tournament GOTY is one of the best games I have ever played. The graphics are amazing, the gameplay is action packed – so fast and adrenaline pumping. It is a pure Arena FPS, and in my opinion Unreal perfected the formula with UT GOTY. I’ve played the later games, which are fun in their own way – but this is just perfection. I loved the Mortal Kombat style voice over as the match went on…”Killing Spree….MULTI KILL” – and the tirade of smartass one liners from the bots, full of personality each one of them. The science fiction theme allows so much variety in levels, which are all full of colour and life…no brown and drab here. Musically, the tracks are all pumping electronica, that capture the essence of each level and the thrill of combat. The story, thin as it is, is all it needs to be – a couple of lines introducing the character or level, and the fact you are in an interstellar deathmatch tourney run by an evil corporation (cool!). The levels are awe inspiring, and I’d have to say the Facing World CTF map is up there with icons such as the Colosseum and Pyramids in its grandeur and online community reverence. No wonder it appears in all the sequels! Even if the online community dies off for this game (I can still get a match online today (2016) through the game which was released in 1999!) – I could always play with the bots, which are powered by the amazing Reaper technology which kept me hooked on Quake when I was younger. Thankfully I discovered this game late in life, otherwise I probably would have been hooked and not able to study or work or find a relationship. A masterpiece.

22008482.review:
Llevo jugando desde poco despues que el juego saliera pero no tenía la dicha de jugar online en ese entonces.

Así es como se hacen (o se hacían) los verdaderos juegos shooter online, incluso el offline es entretenido para los principiantes. Nada de elegir sólo 2 armas, sin granadas, sin regeneración de salud, sin caminadas lentas o sprints limitados,sin rangos donde tienes más beneficios, sin disparos aleatorios para hacer headshot y un montón de cosas más que hacen hoy día con los shooters.

Sólo un buen juego frenético donde si bien puedes encontrar algunos power-ups no siempre están a tu disposición. 

En los duelos o mejor dicho, 1vs1 el que mejor movimientos y control de los mapas tenga sin duda es quien gana... obvio la puntería cuenta igual pero aveces eso no te sirve si no sabes que hacer en los diferentes mapas.

Un basto, muy basto contenido gratuito creado por los usuarios desde que el juego salió a la luz desde el primer unreal. 

Los mods es lo mejor del juego. No son muchos pero se hacen notar desde que ingresas al juego en línea. Cada uno te hace mejorar considerablemente en pequeños aspectos tus habilidades. Otros quizá no te agraden pero jugarlos ya es toda una experiencia. En lo personal el BunnyTrack es mi favorito, Tanto así que dejé de jugar los demás.

Las armas es la mejor parte del juego. Están esparcidas por todo el mapa y debes encontrar la que más te acomode. Por lo general la sniper y la shock rifle son las más utilizada pero cuando no las tienes simplemente no sabes cómo lidiar con las demás armas y eres hombre muerto. Entrenate en cada una de ellas por que cuando menos lo esperas las necesitarás.

Desgraciadamente, no hace mucho el juego perdió interés y ahora está muriendo lentamente. Aún hay quienes juegan bastante pero se perdió el lado competitivo y aunque todavía hay una tonelada de servers, casi todos están vacíos y no veo con buenos ojos el nuevo Unreal Tournament y creo que nadie, pues con pocos servers no hay casi actividad. 

En fin, vale la pena jugarlo y darle la oportunidad por que al jugarlo te garantizo que ganarás una gran habilidad para cualquier otro shooter aunque el modo de jugarlo sea completamente distinto.

If this game was free and open sourced so it could adapt to modern hardware then I'd say brilliant. As it is, it's the exact same program from 1999 and appears incompatible with modern hardware. I have a pretty decent PC ( i5-3570K, 8GB, SSD,  GSX 660 ) yet I get random pauses during game play and long waits at the start of each level telling me it's "precaching". I used to love this game this is totally unplayable.

The company has put no effort into compatability with modern graphics cards and no effort into using better textures or using any of the better user designed levels. I stopped playing after just two screens and thought "I've been had". Can I get my money back?

[EDIT]
After a lot of trial and error I found that switching to OpenGL in the graphics options fixes the pause options I was getting. I'm quite enjoying the game now. I still think it should be cheaper, with better textures and additional maps. It just seems like a wasted oportunity to me and the price still seems steep for an 18 year old piece of software. 

I do love the game though :(
